# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(s::AbstractString, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(s)
    result = []
    for word in words
        if !isempty(result) && length(result[end]) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            push!(result, "")
        end
        push!(result, result[end-1] * string(word, " ") |> strip)
    end
    return join(result)
end

# Example
julia> wrap_string("This is a very long text which we want to wrap at 10 characters per line.", 10)
"This\nis a\nvery\nlong\ntext\nwhich\nwe\nwant\nto\nwrap\nat\n10\ncharacters\nper\nline."
```
